message: Hey everyone.  We just launched our product Stackd.  If anyone wants to give it a go you can sign up for a preview account (free until May 7) at https://stackd.com/preview
More info about the product is at https://stackd.com/ - Would love to get some feedback!
Ooh, shiny! Will definitely check it out.
the top bar needs a bit of work
aka... too much gradient
@sausman brilliant idea for stackd dude... 2 questions, is the preview account free forever? and will you consider releasing the code (open source or with license), aka. directly compete with cpanel?
@unwrangle Thanks!  The preview account is free until May 7th.  We aren't planning on releasing the codebase, however we open sourced a few things at https://github.com/stackd
@sausman ah, so after the 7th, it'll jump to 'personal'? fair enough. anyways, congrats and good luck sir
is .htaccess relevant in the website hosted folders?
@adnans yes it is
@unwrangle thanks!
What's special about it, I don't get it.
If someone is paying $50 a month they should just get on ec2 or linode or rackspace cloud
it's not dead yet, but the future is not bright
also lamp is not a business for the future
Cool project!
@ccarnino thanks!

@apphacker Most people on HN would probably go with ec2 etc. (myself included) but a lot of people don't know how to manage their own server or don't want to bother with it every time they make a site.
Why should people use this instead of dotcloud?
@jca people can actually signup for this?

First glance, your pricing model needs to reflect the EC2 underpinnings, and you need something to differentiate yourself from all the other sharedhosting providers. I'd also suggest MySQL 5.5 if you're expecting real development.
well I admire the effort sausman and wish you lots of look, good job!

@bifrost We wanted to make the pricing familiar to new comers/existing middle tier customers. No more File-Transfer-Pain, easy collaboration, automatic versioning of files, scalable, performant platform.
@italiano40 We do have our "Max" plan https://stackd.com/signup/max if is that not enough, I'm all ears for exactly how much you need!
@wayoutmind are you guys going to ever support like an enterprise tier, like something unlimited for power users? it looks cool i wish i could use it but it is too limited for me
@bifrost Also, We'll be supporting MySQL 5.5 at launch time (May 7)
@wayoutmind like an unlimited and maybe ruby on rails supports
Basically like a fully hosting support

@italiano40 We've explored the "unlimited" account, but right now we're focusing our efforts toward making sure our platform is every bit as performant as dedicated hosts. We think performance should be our unlimited. We're working on Rails support as we speak, making sure it's every bit as secure and easy to use as our PHP platform is our top priority.

@wayoutmind Sure, but your pricing is like 3-5x what other players are doing for basically the same thing. Your confirmation email also goes into my spamfolder for improper formatting. html email for confirmation messages are also kinda fail.

@bifrost Thanks for letting us know about the confirmation email going to spam, we'll get on making it more inbox friendly. Sure, others may be doing x thing but for x price, but we're more than ecstatic with what our users have been telling us about our product/experience.
